description: Retrieves the forecast data for a predictive scaling policy. Load forecasts are predictions of the hourly load values using historical load data from CloudWatch and an analysis of historical trends. Capacity forecasts are represented as predicted values for the minimum capacity that is needed on an hourly basis, based on the hourly load forecast. A minimum of 24 hours of data is required to create the initial forecasts. However, having a full 14 days of historical data results in more accurate forecasts.

parameters.name: ServiceNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the Amazon Web Services service that provides the resource. For a resource provided by your own application or service, use custom-resource instead.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The inclusive start time of the time range for the forecast data to get. At most, the date and time can be one year before the current date and time.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The exclusive end time of the time range for the forecast data to get. The maximum time duration between the start and end time is 30 days.

nested_items.name: LoadForecast
nested_items.description: The load forecast.

nested_items.name: Timestamps
nested_items.description: The timestamps for the data points, in UTC format.
(datetime) ---

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The values of the data points.
(float) ---

nested_items.name: MetricSpecification
nested_items.description: The metric specification for the load forecast.

nested_items.name: TargetValue
nested_items.description: Specifies the target utilization.

nested_items.name: PredefinedMetricPairSpecification
nested_items.description: The predefined metric pair specification that determines the appropriate scaling metric and load metric to use.

nested_items.name: PredefinedMetricType
nested_items.description: Indicates which metrics to use. There are two different types of metrics for each metric type: one is a load metric and one is a scaling metric.

nested_items.name: ResourceLabel
nested_items.description: A label that uniquely identifies a specific target group from which to determine the total and average request count.

nested_items.name: PredefinedScalingMetricSpecification
nested_items.description: The predefined scaling metric specification.

nested_items.name: PredefinedMetricType
nested_items.description: The metric type.

nested_items.name: ResourceLabel
nested_items.description: A label that uniquely identifies a specific target group from which to determine the average request count.

nested_items.name: PredefinedLoadMetricSpecification
nested_items.description: The predefined load metric specification.

nested_items.name: PredefinedMetricType
nested_items.description: The metric type.

nested_items.name: ResourceLabel
nested_items.description: A label that uniquely identifies a target group.

nested_items.name: CustomizedScalingMetricSpecification
nested_items.description: The customized scaling metric specification.

nested_items.name: MetricDataQueries
nested_items.description: One or more metric data queries to provide data points for a metric specification.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: A short name that identifies the object's results in the response. This name must be unique among all MetricDataQuery objects specified for a single scaling policy. If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the mathematical expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscores. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: The math expression to perform on the returned data, if this object is performing a math expression. This expression can use the Id of the other metrics to refer to those metrics, and can also use the Id of other expressions to use the result of those expressions.

nested_items.name: MetricStat
nested_items.description: Information about the metric data to return.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: Describes the dimensions of the metric.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the dimension.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the metric.

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The statistic to return. It can include any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic. For a list of valid values, see the table in Statistics in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit to use for the returned data points. For a complete list of the units that CloudWatch supports, see the MetricDatum data type in the Amazon CloudWatch API Reference.

nested_items.name: Label
nested_items.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is a math expression, so that you know what the value represents.

nested_items.name: ReturnData
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

nested_items.description: The customized load metric specification.
